featured.title: Puglia
featured.subtitle: Where the heel of Italy meets the sea
featured.description: Puglia is what happens when coastal Italy stays grounded. It's stunning — whitewashed towns, two seas, endless olive groves — but it's also real: hot summers, slower infrastructure, and a way of life that prioritizes human connection over efficiency. You don't move here for convenience; you move here for warmth, literally and socially. The best part? It's wildly affordable by Western European standards and still relatively undiscovered by the international retirement crowd.
